title: Mistborn: The Hero of Ages
author: Brandon Sanderson
blurb: Book three in the Mistborn trilogy. I don't want to give any spoilers for those reading book one, so I'll just say it starts a bit slower but continues to be quite good.

title: A Guide to the Good Life: The Ancient Art of Stoic Joy
author: William B. Irvine
blurb: A modern day intro to the philosophy of Stoicism. In particular, I enjoyed how practical the book was, with specific practices to be applied to every day life. It's inspired me to read some of the classic Stoic works.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
blurb: I'm a big fan of the quote 'greatness is just a series of ordinary steps viewed at a distance'. This book does an amazing job of showing you all the pieces that created the amazing First Lady. Additional plug that you should get the audio book because it's read by Michelle and is fantastic.

title: Triggers: Creating Behavior That Lasts
author: Marshall Goldsmith
blurb: The book starts a bit slow and ends a bit rambly, but overall it gave several valuable insights about changing behavior. The most powerful to me was the idea to focus more on putting in consistent effort rather than results.

title: Well of Ascension
author: Brandon Sanderson
blurb: Book two in the Mistborn trilogy. I don't want to give any spoilers for those reading book one, so I'll just say it starts a bit slower but continues to be quite good.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
blurb: A heist thriller with a hard magic system where people gain superpowers by eating specific metals.

title: The War of Art
author: Steven Pressfield
blurb: Claims that the hardest part of the creative process is consistently creating. Then it goes way off the rails and claims writing can cure cancer...

title: On Writing: A Memoir Of The Craft
author: Stephen King
blurb: 1 part biography, 1 part treatise on the craft of writing. Full of interesting stories and great advice.

title: Structuring Your Novel
author: K.M. Weiland
blurb: A useful overview of the various structural elements most stories have.
